SENT.plain: We present a 3-month-old girl who showed segmental NF1 and Cobb syndrome
She has a cutaneous vascular malformation located on the middle T (4)-T (6) region superimposed on a giant cutaneous caf√©-au-lait spot

Magnetic resonance arteriography (MRA) revealed bilateral renal artery stenosis, extensive hypertrophy of the spinal epidural venous plexus, coarctation and tubular hypoplasia of the aortic arch and proximal portion of descending aorta
To the best of our knowledge the association of both neurocutaneous disorders has not being previously described
